0.user_question: Kaleb had 12 dollars. If he spent 8 bucks on a new game, how many 2 dollar toys could he buy with the money he had left?

ost_step.1: Start with the amount of money Kaleb had, which was $12.
ost_step.2: Subtract the amount he spent on the new game from his initial amount to find out how much money he has left. He spent $8 on the new game. So, he has $12 (initial amount) - $8 (amount spent on the game) = $4 left.
ost_step.3: Divide the remaining amount by the price of each toy to find out how many 2 dollar toys he can buy. He can buy $4 / $2 = 2 toys.
